revised_title: Dietary Influence on Platelet-Vessel Wall Interaction and its Implications for Ischaemic Heart Disease
tldr: This article explores the impact of diet on platelet-vessel wall interaction and its connection to ischaemic heart disease. The author focuses on the role of polyunsaturated fatty acids, particularly the n-3 family, in modulating platelet behavior. The study of Greenland Eskimos, who consume a diet rich in eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA), reveals a lower incidence of ischaemic heart disease. The author demonstrates that EPA has an anti-aggregatory effect on platelets and suggests that dietary factors can influence platelet-vessel wall interaction, which should be considered in dietary advice to reduce the incidence of ischaemic heart diseases.
